summary: This document is an email chain from March 2, 2021, between FBI personnel, including the Legal Attaché in London, requesting UK Border Force assistance to obtain historical travel records for Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein from 1994 onward, including potential travel via private aircraft. It is part of the ongoing investigation into the Epstein case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The email requests UK travel records for Ghislaine Maxwell from 1994 onward, listing multiple passport details including US, UK, and French passports.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The email requests UK travel records for Jeffrey Epstein from 1994 onward, listing multiple US passport details.

connections.description: Both are subjects of the same FBI investigation into travel records, indicating their association in the case.

events.title: FBI Request for UK Travel Records
events.description: FBI personnel, including the Legal Attaché in London, send a request to UK Border Force for historical travel records for Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein from 1994 onward.

keyFacts: The FBI is actively investigating the travel history of Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein to and from the UK from 1994 onward as of March 2021.
The investigation specifically notes that some or all of the travel may have been via private aircraft.
The document lists multiple passport details for Ghislaine Maxwell, including US, UK, and French passports from various years (1994, 1997, 1998, 2001).
The request is characterized as a 'high profile case' by the FBI Legal Attaché.
The correspondence involves the FBI New York Field Office's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking unit and the FBI Legal Attaché Office at the American Embassy in London.
